com.redhat.rhn.domain.server

Class VirtualInstanceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.common.hibernate.HibernateFactory
      • com.redhat.rhn.domain.server.VirtualInstanceFactory

  • public class VirtualInstanceFactory
extends HibernateFactory
    VirtualInstanceFactory provides data access operations for virtual instances.
    See Also:
    VirtualInstance

      • getInstance

        public static VirtualInstanceFactory getInstance()
        Get instance of this factory.
        Returns:
        VirtualInstanceFactory instance

      • saveVirtualInstance

        public void saveVirtualInstance(VirtualInstance virtualInstance)
        Saves the virtual instance to the database. The save is cascading so that if the virtual instance is a registered guest, then any changes to this virtual instance's guest server will be persisted as well.
        Parameters:
        virtualInstance - The virtual instance to save

      • lookupByGuestId

        public VirtualInstance lookupByGuestId(Org org,
                                       java.lang.Long id)
        Gets the virtual Instance for a given Sid for a guest
        Parameters:
        id - the system id of the guest
        org - the org to check against
        Returns:
        the guest's virtual instance

      • isOutdated

        public boolean isOutdated(VirtualInstance guest)
        Check if the given guest instance is outdated. (i.e. a newer instance exists with the same UUID)
        Parameters:
        guest - Virtual instance to check.
        Returns:
        True if outdated, false otherwise.

      • lookupById

        public VirtualInstance lookupById(java.lang.Long id)
        Retrieves the virtual instance with the specified ID.
        Parameters:
        id - The primary key
        Returns:
        The virtual instance with the specified ID or null if no match is found.

      • deleteVirtualInstance

        public void deleteVirtualInstance(VirtualInstance virtualInstance)
        Deletes the virtual instance from the database. If the virtual instance is a registered guest, then its guest system will be deleted as well.
        Parameters:
        virtualInstance - The virtual instance to delete

      • findGuestsWithNonVirtHostByOrg

        public java.util.Set findGuestsWithNonVirtHostByOrg(Org org)
        Finds all registered guests, within a particular org, whose hosts do not have any virtualization entitlements.
        Parameters:
        org - The org to search in
        Returns:
        A set of GuestAndNonVirtHostView objects
        See Also:
        GuestAndNonVirtHostView

      • findGuestsWithoutAHostByOrg

        public java.util.Set findGuestsWithoutAHostByOrg(Org org)
        Finds all registered guests, within a particular org, who do not have a registered host.
        Parameters:
        org - The org to search in
        Returns:
        set A set of GuestAndNonVirtHostView objects
        See Also:
        GuestAndNonVirtHostView
